questions.question: What significant effect did the Treaty of Paris, signed after the French and Indian War, have on France?

choices.answer: France had to withdraw to its empire in Central and South America.
France lost its claim to the entire Florida territory.
France had lost most of its territory and power in North America.

questions.question: How were the Iroquois helpful in assisting the British troops?

choices.answer: The Iroquois had better knowledge of the area.
The Iroquois had more modern equipment than the British.
The Iroquois had better knowledge of the habits of the French.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes how the Intolerable Acts affected the American colonies?

choices.answer: The acts caused the colonies to declare war against the British government.
The acts caused the colonies to quarter British troops without payment.
The acts caused the colonies to unify against the British government.

questions.question: What was the impact of the Olive Branch Petition?

choices.answer: It declared independence from Britain for the first time.
It failed to bring about peace and only angered King George III.
It caused there to be a brief break in the fighting.

questions.question: What major advantage did the colonists have over the British during the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: colonists had more supplies than the British
colonists had a better knowledge of the land than the British
colonists had more soldiers than the British

questions.question: Which of the following occurred during the Second Spanish Period?

choices.answer: The Treaty of Paris (1763) gave Florida to Spain.
Pinckney’s Treaty established the northern boundary of Florida.
Significant battles of the Revolutionary War took place.

questions.question: Why did Congress feel the need to boost American morale in early 1778?

choices.answer: The American army had given up and began to side with the British.
Americans were beginning to lose hope of winning their independence.
The American army was about to defeat the British.

questions.question: What was the impact of Minutemen during the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: They resisted British forces using the same tactics as the British.
As wealthy farmers, they provided much needed financial support to the army
They were trained soldiers who could prepare for battle quickly.

questions.question: What was the mistake British General Charles Cornwallis made that ultimately caused his defeat?

choices.answer: He miscalculated the strength of the Continental Army in Charlottesville VA
He retreated to Yorktown where he was trapped.
He failed to cut off supply routes to the Carolinas.

questions.question: How did the French respond when the colonies defeated the British at Saratoga in the Revolutionary War?

choices.answer: They were encouraged to support the patriot effort.
They withdrew their support of the British.
They supported the British in their efforts to control the colonies.

questions.question: What motivated most African American soldiers to fight in the Revolutionary War with the Patriots?

choices.answer: the hope that the war would also bring an end to slavery
the desire to achieve military ranks
the fear of what would happen if they did not fight in the war

questions.question: Which statement correctly contrasts Mary Ludwig Hays’ contributions during the Revolution to those of Betsy Ross?

choices.answer: Hays made guns and cannons and Ross helped on the home front.
Hays operated a cannon in battle and Ross made the American flag.
Hays was killed in battle and Ross pushed for equal rights for women.
